bibl.title: [Commission] 1839 July 19 [for] Thomas B. Reppatoe / [signed by] Newton Cannon
bibl.note: This document is a commission dated July 19, 1839 for Thomas B. Reppatoe to serve as justice of the peace in Jefferson County, Tennessee.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: STATE OF TENNESSEE
TO ALL WHO SHALL SEE THESE PRESENTS--Greeting:
div1.p: KNOW YE, That we do commission Thomas B. Reppetoe of the county of Jeffersona Justice of the Peace in and for said county, and do authorize and empower him to execute and fulfil the duties of a Justice of the Peace in said county, agreeably to the constitution and laws of this State; with all the powers, privileges and enduments thereto appertaining.
In testimony whereof, J. Newton Cannon, Governor of the State aforesaid, have hereunto set my hand, and caused the great Seal of the State to be affixed at Nashville, the 19 day of July 1839.
div1.closer:
N. Cannon By the Governor: Luke Leaf Secretary of State.
Thomas D. Reppatoe Com as Justice of the Peace filed in office 2 Sept 1839 and the Oath of Office administeredJoseph Hamilton Clerk
